issue.title: undefined location of sandia hand contact sensors

content.raw:
Yes except the integers in pdf for the top half of the finger, which ranges from 1~12. These are index 6~17 in the array. So not really minus 1.

We took data from the real hand. We found out every sensor on the finger is different and produces slightly different output values. Instead of modeling all the variations we decided to set a range in the simulation. The force feedback from ODE is scaled to be within this range. So yes, the higher the ODE force feedback, the higher the tactile sensor output value will be. Similar behavior on the real hand.
content.html:
Yes except the integers in pdf for the top half of the finger, which ranges from 1~12. These are index 6~17 in the array. So not really minus 1.

We took data from the real hand. We found out every sensor on the finger is different and produces slightly different output values. Instead of modeling all the variations we decided to set a range in the simulation. The force feedback from ODE is scaled to be within this range. So yes, the higher the ODE force feedback, the higher the tactile sensor output value will be. Similar behavior on the real hand.
